problems.title: Decode String
problems.description:
Given an encoded string, return its decoded string. The encoding rule is: k[encoded_string], where the encoded_string inside the square brackets is being repeated exactly k times. Note that k is guaranteed to be a positive integer. You may assume that the input string is always valid; No extra white spaces, square brackets are well-formed, etc.

Input Format:
First line contains an encoded string.

Output Format:
Print the decoded string.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3[a]2[bc]

Sample Output
aaabcbc

Sample Input
3[a2[c]]

Sample Output
accaccacc

Sample Input
2[abc]3[cd]ef

Sample Output
abcabccdcdcdef

Explanation:
"3[a]2[bc]" decodes to "aaabcbc". "3[a2[c]]" decodes to "accaccacc".
problems.constraints:
1 <= length of string <= 30
k is always a positive integer
hintsList: Use a stack. When you see a number, save it. When you see '[', push current string and number to stack. When you see ']', pop and repeat the string.
